intro: Lupinus graciliflorus, commonly known as slender-flowered lupine, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually blue to violet in color, arranged in dense spikes, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Lupinus graciliflorus is known for its nitrogen-fixing ability, contributing to soil fertility in its native environment.
